lexUnit.name: verify.v
lexUnit.definition: COD: make sure or demonstrate that (something) is true, accurate, or justified.

sentence.text: They verify that is coming from where the person says it 's coming .
I asked them to verify that .
The technical officer was verifying that all platforms within firing range were accepting the signal .
The bank , upon verifying compliance with the terms of the credit , and obtaining its customer 's payment or reimbursement , released the goods to the customer .
AN ATTEMPT by an Australian scientist to verify American claims that Vietnamese forces are spraying chemical weapons in South-East Asia has failed to either prove or disprove the accusation .
Special damages must be calculated to date and verified by exhibiting vouchers ( eg employers ' letters ) .
The data have been verified immunohistochemically using the monoclonal antibody Ki-67 to show a reduction in the labelling index .

This was verified by the farmer .

The incidence was verified by macroscopic and microscopic inspection .
Composers Pen allows you to verify your work on screen prior to printing .

Now look here , if you honestly think that I 'm going down to the police station and verifying a story like that then you can think again !
He seldom troubles to verify a reference or document a case , his rejections tend to be magisterially dismissive , his judgements readily upstage even his most august victims .
A second meeting will help to verify the answers .

British movements in that direction were verified , and on 9 September Bülow ordered the Second Army to withdraw .
